com.agenarisk.api.model

Class Scenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agenarisk.api.model.Scenario
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable<ScenarioException>

    public class Scenario
extends java.lang.Object
implements Identifiable<ScenarioException>
    Scenario class represents an equivalent to a Scenario in AgenaRisk Desktop or Scenario in AgenaRisk Java API v1.

      • setId

        public final void setId(java.lang.String id)
                 throws ScenarioException
        Changes the ID of this Network to the provided ID, if the new ID is not already taken.
        Will lock IDContainer.class while doing so.
        Specified by:
        setId in interface Identifiable<ScenarioException>
        Parameters:
        id - the new ID
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if fails to change ID

      • setObservationHard

        public <T> void setObservationHard(Node node,
                                   T value)
                            throws ScenarioException
        Sets a hard observation for a Node.
        Any existing observations are removed and replaced with this one.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of observation (expecting a String when setting a particular state or a Double when setting a numeric value)
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to set observation for
        value - the observation value
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if any of the following applies:
        ∙ Node's Network does not belong to this Model;
        ∙ State does not exist
        ∙ Value passed is an invalid observation for the given Node

      • setObservationSoft

        public void setObservationSoft(Node node,
                               java.lang.String[] states,
                               java.lang.Double[] weights)
                        throws ScenarioException
        Sets a soft observation for the node, assigning a given weights to given states.
        Note that weights will be normalised to sum up to 1.
        Any existing observations are removed and replaced with this one.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to set observation for
        states - Array of states
        weights - Array of weights
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if any of the following applies:
        ∙ Node's Network does not belong to this Model;
        ∙ Any of the states do not exist
        ∙ Value passed is an invalid observation for the given Node
        ∙ Unequal size of arrays

      • setObservationSoft

        public void setObservationSoft(Node node,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> weights)
                        throws ScenarioException
        Sets a soft observation for the node, assigning a given weights to given states.
        Note that weights will be normalised to sum up to 1.
        Only the states with some weight must be provided. The rest will be assumed to have zero weight.
        Any existing observations are removed and replaced with this one.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to set observation for
        weights - the map of states and weights
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if any of the following applies:
        ∙ Node's Network does not belong to this Model;
        ∙ Any of the states do not exist
        ∙ Value passed is an invalid observation for the given Node

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(org.apache.sling.commons.json.JSONArray observations)
                     throws ScenarioException
        Sets observations according to the given JSON.
        Any existing observations are removed and replaced with this one.
        Parameters:
        observations - JSON with observations
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if any of the following applies:
        ∙ Node's Network does not belong to this Model;
        ∙ Any of the states do not exist
        ∙ Value passed is an invalid observation for the given Node
        ∙ Missing or invalid attributes

      • clearObservation

        public void clearObservation(Node node)
        Clears an observation from a Node if it exists.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to clear the observation from

      • clearObservations

        public void clearObservations()
        Clears all observations from this Scenario for all Networks and Nodes

      • hasObservation

        public boolean hasObservation(Node node)
        Checks whether the Node has an observation set.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node to check for observations
        Returns:
        true if there is an observation for the Node in this Scenario

      • getObservation

        public Observation getObservation(Node node)
        Returns a view of the observation for the given node if there is one.
        Note that this is just a view of the observation and any changes to it will not affect anything beyond this particular view.
        To change an observation, use setObservation() method.
        Parameters:
        node - the observed Node
        Returns:
        null if there is no observation or either HardObservation or SoftObservation

      • getMarginals

        public DataSet getMarginals(Node node)
                     throws ScenarioException
        Returns the current data set of marginals for the given Node.
        Parameters:
        node - the Node for which marginals should be returned
        Returns:
        Data set of current marginals
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if there are no marginals in this Scenario for this Node or the Node and Scenario belog to different Models

      • getMarginals

        public java.util.List<DataSet> getMarginals()
        Gets all marginals for all Nodes for this Scenario.
        Returns:
        list of all marginals for all Nodes for this Scenario

      • loadMarginals

        public void loadMarginals(org.apache.sling.commons.json.JSONObject json)
                   throws ScenarioException
        Rebuilds marginals for this Scenario from a given JSON
        Parameters:
        json - marginals data in JSON format
        Throws:
        ScenarioException - if JSON data is invalid
